a:s.a:s: /* * Library: IMMZD5DTYellowFeverContraindicationsLogic (IMMZ.D5.DT.Yellow fever contraindications) * Rule: Check for contraindications before administering the vaccine(s) due * Decision Table: IMMZ.D5.DT.Yellow fever contraindications * Trigger: IMMZ.D5 Determine vaccine(s) to be administered based on contraindications */ library IMMZD5DTYellowFeverContraindicationsLogic

a:s.a:s: 'Do not vaccinate client with yellow fever as yellow fever vaccination is contraindicated in client\'s aged less than 6 months.'
'Do not vaccinate client with yellow fever as yellow fever vaccination is contraindicated in severely immunocompromised clients.'

when.name: Yellow fever vaccination is contraindicated Case 1

then.value: Do not vaccinate client with yellow fever as yellow fever vaccination is contraindicated in client's aged less than 6 months.

when.name: Yellow fever vaccination is contraindicated Case 2

then.value: Do not vaccinate client with yellow fever as yellow fever vaccination is contraindicated in severely immunocompromised clients.

def.name: Clinical judgement is required. Create a clinical note Guidance

a:t.name: output
a:t.value: Clinical judgement is required. Create a clinical note Guidance

a:s.a:s: "Clinical judgement is required. Create a clinical note Case 1"

'Check if exceptions to age range is being met, consider risks of vaccination and make a clinical judgement. Vaccine is not recommended for those aged 6–8 months, except during epidemics when the risk of infection with the yellow fever virus is very high.'
"Clinical judgement is required. Create a clinical note Case 2"
'Conduct a risk–benefit assessment taking into account the risk of acquiring yellow fever disease, consider risks of potential adverse events following immunization and make a clinical judgement.'
"Clinical judgement is required. Create a clinical note Case 3"
'Conduct a risk–benefit assessment since yellow fever is a live vaccine and make a clinical judgement. Pregnant women may be vaccinated during epidemics at the direction of local health authorities.'
"Clinical judgement is required. Create a clinical note Case 4"
'Conduct a risk–benefit assessment since yellow fever is a live vaccine and make a clinical judgement. Lactating women should be advised that the benefits of breastfeeding far outweigh alternatives.'

when.name: Clinical judgement is required. Create a clinical note Case 1

then.value: Check if exceptions to age range is being met, consider risks of vaccination and make a clinical judgement. Vaccine is not recommended for those aged 6–8 months, except during epidemics when the risk of infection with the yellow fever virus is very high.

when.name: Clinical judgement is required. Create a clinical note Case 2

then.value: Conduct a risk–benefit assessment taking into account the risk of acquiring yellow fever disease, consider risks of potential adverse events following immunization and make a clinical judgement.

when.name: Clinical judgement is required. Create a clinical note Case 3

then.value: Conduct a risk–benefit assessment since yellow fever is a live vaccine and make a clinical judgement. Pregnant women may be vaccinated during epidemics at the direction of local health authorities.

when.name: Clinical judgement is required. Create a clinical note Case 4

then.value: Conduct a risk–benefit assessment since yellow fever is a live vaccine and make a clinical judgement. Lactating women should be advised that the benefits of breastfeeding far outweigh alternatives.

def.name: Yellow fever vaccination could be contraindicated. Clinical judgement is required. Create a clinical note Guidance

a:t.name: output
a:t.value: Yellow fever vaccination could be contraindicated. Clinical judgement is required. Create a clinical note Guidance

a:t.name: guidance
a:t.value: Do not vaccinate client with yellow fever if client has severe hypersensitivity to egg antigens.

a:s.a:s: 'Do not vaccinate client with yellow fever if client has severe hypersensitivity to egg antigens.'

expression.value: Do not vaccinate client with yellow fever if client has severe hypersensitivity to egg antigens.

a:s.a:s: 'Do not vaccinate client with yellow fever as yellow fever vaccination is contraindicated in client\'s aged less than 6 months.'
"Clinical judgement is required. Create a clinical note Case 1"

'Check if exceptions to age range is being met, consider risks of vaccination and make a clinical judgement. Vaccine is not recommended for those aged 6–8 months, except during epidemics when the risk of infection with the yellow fever virus is very high.'
"Clinical judgement is required. Create a clinical note Case 2"
'Conduct a risk–benefit assessment taking into account the risk of acquiring yellow fever disease, consider risks of potential adverse events following immunization and make a clinical judgement.'
"Yellow fever vaccination could be contraindicated. Clinical judgement is required. Create a clinical note"
'Do not vaccinate client with yellow fever if client has severe hypersensitivity to egg antigens.'
'Do not vaccinate client with yellow fever as yellow fever vaccination is contraindicated in severely immunocompromised clients.'
"Clinical judgement is required. Create a clinical note Case 3"
'Conduct a risk–benefit assessment since yellow fever is a live vaccine and make a clinical judgement. Pregnant women may be vaccinated during epidemics at the direction of local health authorities.'
"Clinical judgement is required. Create a clinical note Case 4"
'Conduct a risk–benefit assessment since yellow fever is a live vaccine and make a clinical judgement. Lactating women should be advised that the benefits of breastfeeding far outweigh alternatives.'
